terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.intro: Welcome to MindMeter! By using this website, you agree to comply with the following terms. Please read carefully before using our services.

1.title: Acceptance of Terms:
1.desc: By accessing and using MindMeter, you are deemed to have accepted these terms of use.

2.title: Changes to Terms:
2.desc: MindMeter reserves the right to change or modify the terms at any time without prior notice. You should check regularly for updates.

3.title: Intellectual Property:
3.desc: All content, images, and data on MindMeter are owned by us. Copying or reusing for commercial purposes without permission is strictly prohibited.

4.title: Information Security:
4.desc: MindMeter is committed to protecting users' personal information in accordance with our published privacy policy.

5.title: User Responsibility:
5.desc: You agree to provide accurate information and not use the website for illegal purposes or to harm others.

6.title: Limitation of Liability:
6.desc: MindMeter is not responsible for any damages arising from the use of the website, including but not limited to the use of information, test results, or advice on the site.

7.title: Contact:
7.desc: If you have any questions about the terms of use, please contact us at: trankiencuong30072003@gmail.com

forgot.title: Forgot Password

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: is committed to protecting your privacy and personal information. This policy explains how we collect, use, store, protect, and process your personal information when you use our mental health support services.

section1.title: 1. Information We Collect
section1.personalInfoDesc: Full name, email, phone number, profile picture, date of birth, gender.
section1.socialInfoDesc: Google, Facebook account ID, profile picture, linked email.
section1.technicalInfoDesc: IP address, browser type, device, operating system, access time.
section1.behaviorInfoDesc: Access history, website interactions, test results, consultation records.

section2.title: 2. Purpose of Information Use
section2.purpose3: Personalize experience, provide mental health assessments and recommendations.
section2.purpose4: Send notifications, confirmation emails, mental health resources (with your consent).
section2.purpose5: Analyze, improve service quality and system security.
section2.purpose6: Comply with legal regulations and requirements from authorities.

section3.title: 3. Information Sharing
section3.sharing1: We do not share your personal information with third parties, except with your consent or as required by law.
section3.sharing2: Information may be shared with service providers (e.g., email verification, payment) but only within necessary scope and under strict security measures.

section4.title: 4. Information Security
section4.security1: Passwords and sensitive data are encrypted and stored securely.
section4.security2: We apply physical, technical, and administrative security measures to protect information from unauthorized access, loss, or misuse.
section4.security3: Staff are trained in security and strictly follow data protection procedures.

section5.title: 5. User Rights
section5.rights1: You have the right to access, edit, update, or delete your personal information at any time.
section5.rights2: You can request us to stop sending promotional emails or unwanted notifications.
section5.rights3: You have the right to provide feedback or file complaints about the use of personal information.

section6.title: 6. Storage & Retention Period
section6.storage1: Personal information is stored on MindMeter's secure system.
section6.storage2: We only retain information for the time necessary for intended use or as required by law.
section6.storage3: After you request account deletion, information will be deleted or hidden from the system within 30 days.

section7.title: 7. Cookies & Tracking Technology
section7.cookies1: We use cookies to remember login information, personalize experience, and analyze user behavior.
section7.cookies2: You can customize or disable cookies in your browser, however some features may be limited.

section8.title: 8. Links to Other Websites
section8.links: Our website may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the content or privacy policies of these websites.

section9.title: 9. Policy Changes
section9.changes: This policy may be updated to comply with legal regulations or service changes. All changes will be notified on the website.

section10.title: 10. Contact
section10.contactIntro: If you have any questions, requests, or complaints related to the privacy policy, please contact:
section10.address: Address: 36 Xuan Thuy, Cau Giay, Hanoi

guide.title: User Guide MindMeter

sections.title: Introduction
content: MindMeter is a platform for mental health assessment.
The app helps you self-check and monitor your psychological state.

sections.title: Getting Started
content: Register an account to use all features.
Take the PHQ-9 depression test to get an assessment result.

sections.title: Support
content: If you need support, contact our experts via the Contact section.
You can also view more user guide documents in this section.

guide.footer: Wish you an effective, safe experience with MindMeter and always maintain your mental health!

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.intro: MindMeter provides tests, information, and advice on mental health for support, reference, and raising community awareness. However, please note:

items.text: Tests and information on MindMeter are not official medical diagnostic tools. If you have abnormal mental health symptoms, please contact a specialist or reputable medical facility.
MindMeter is not responsible for any consequences arising from the use of information, test results, or advice on the website.
Content on MindMeter is compiled from reputable sources, but may not be suitable for all individual cases.
We are committed to protecting personal information according to our privacy policy, but are not responsible if users voluntarily share information externally.
If you have questions about the disclaimer, please contact us via email: trankiencuong30072003@gmail.com

depressionTest.introTitle: Take the Online Depression Test – Depression Assessment
depressionTest.introDesc1: Take depression tests to assess your depression level. These tests are designed to help mental health professionals evaluate mood, symptoms, and the level of depression in patients. The results will include advice to help you get an overview of your depression level. <0>Note: These tests are not a medical diagnosis.</0>
depressionTest.introDesc2: All depression tests on the MindMeter website are completely free, simple, and easy to use. Start your test now!

testHistory.title: Your Test History
testHistory.noHistoryMessage: You have not taken any test yet.
testHistory.needMoreTestsForChart: You need to take more tests to see the statistics chart.
testHistory.subtitle: Review your psychological progress through each test

testListSection.title: Online Depression Test List
testListSection.description: Depression tests at <0>MindMeter</0> are built on scientific research and aggregate reputable assessment tools in the fields of psychology and psychiatry. Each test is designed to help you identify early signs of depression, anxiety, stress, or other mental health issues. The results not only help you determine your current level but also provide advice and guidance so you can proactively take care of your mental health. If you are feeling stressed, fatigued for a long time, or experiencing unusual emotional changes, choose the appropriate test to check and get timely consultation.
testListSection.note: These tests do not replace professional diagnosis from a doctor or psychologist. If your results show a high risk, please proactively contact a specialist for the best support.

DASS-21.label: IMPORTANT TEST
DASS-21.name: Anxiety – Depression – Stress Test (DASS 21)
DASS-21.description: The DASS 21 (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale) is an in-depth assessment tool for levels of depression, anxiety, and stress. The DASS 21 test is recommended for those showing signs of depression, anxiety, and stress, especially those experiencing stressful situations in life such as work pressure, family, or crisis events.
DASS-21.target: People with symptoms of anxiety, depression, and stress.
DASS-21.purpose: Assessment and recommendation of appropriate treatment methods.

DASS-42.label: IMPORTANT TEST
DASS-42.name: Anxiety – Depression – Stress Test (DASS 42)
DASS-42.description: The DASS 42 is an important tool for measuring the degree of anxiety, depression, and stress disorders. Built on scientific research, this test is recognized for its accuracy and reliability in assessing an individual's psychological state. The DASS 42 test is recommended for those showing signs of anxiety, depression, and stress disorders.
DASS-42.target: People with symptoms of anxiety, depression, and stress.
DASS-42.purpose: Assessment and recommendation of appropriate treatment methods.

RADS.label: PERIODIC TEST
RADS.name: Adolescent Depression Test (RADS)
RADS.description: The RADS (Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale) is a tool used to detect and measure depression in adolescents. The accuracy and reliability of the RADS test have been confirmed by many studies, making it an important tool for researchers and mental health professionals.

BDI.label: POPULAR TEST
BDI.name: Beck Depression Test (BDI)
BDI.description: The BECK test, also known as the BDI (Beck Depression Inventory), is one of the most popular tools for measuring an individual's level of depression. Developed by psychologist Aaron T. Beck, this test has been extensively studied and proven to be highly reliable and valid in various mental health studies.
BDI.target: People with symptoms such as fatigue, sadness, etc.
BDI.purpose: Screening, detection, and recommendation of appropriate treatment.

EPDS.label: IMPORTANT TEST
EPDS.name: Postpartum Depression Test (EPDS)
EPDS.description: The EPDS (Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale) is an important tool used to measure the level of postpartum depression in women. Developed based on scientific research and clinical practice, EPDS has been proven to be reliable and feasible for screening and assessing postpartum depression symptoms.
EPDS.target: Women with symptoms of postpartum depression.
EPDS.purpose: Assessment and determination of the level of postpartum depression in women.

SAS.label: POPULAR TEST
SAS.name: Zung Anxiety Test (SAS)
SAS.description: The ZUNG (Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale) is a reputable and popular tool for measuring the level of depression in individuals. Developed by William WK Zung, this test is widely used in clinical and mental health research. It evaluates depression symptoms across four groups: mood, perception, reduced function, and emotion, etc.
SAS.target: People with symptoms of anxiety disorders.
SAS.purpose: Assessment of severity and finding treatment solutions.

aboutSection.whyP1: Depression is not a minor issue. If not detected and treated in time, it can cause serious impacts on all aspects of life, including health, work, family, and social relationships. Those suffering from this disorder often feel tired, lack energy, lose interest in previously enjoyed activities, and may even have suicidal thoughts.
aboutSection.whyP2: Depression is currently a global issue, affecting about 5% of the world's population. In Vietnam, according to the Ministry of Health, about 3 million people are living with this condition, and the number is increasing, especially among teenagers. Therefore, self-checking and assessing mental health status is extremely important.
aboutSection.whyP3: Online depression tests on reputable sites like Testtramcam.vn can help you accurately determine your level of depression. From there, you can find timely interventions to improve your quality of life effectively. Take a little time and do the test now!
aboutSection.trustP1: MindMeter's depression tests are developed based on research by leading psychologists worldwide, then translated into Vietnamese to suit local users, and reviewed by mental health experts and major reputable organizations in Vietnam.
aboutSection.trustP2: In addition to accurately identifying the type of depression, these tests are also categorized by age and target group, and recommend appropriate treatment methods. With guaranteed quality, this is a reliable tool for you to self-assess your mental health.
aboutSection.trustP3: All tests are completely free and provide quick results. The purpose of Testtramcam.vn is to help those with psychological symptoms quickly diagnose their condition.

introduce.intro1: is a leading online platform for mental health assessment, screening, and support for Vietnamese people. We provide scientific-based depression, anxiety, stress, postpartum depression tests... to help you identify mental health issues early and proactively care for your own and your loved ones' mental well-being.
introduce.mission: is to raise community awareness about mental health, making it easy for everyone to access screening tools, assessments, and timely support. We believe that mental health is as important as physical health, and being proactive in checking and prevention is the key to a happier, more successful life.
introduce.value2: Science - Reliability - Security - Free - Easy to use
introduce.value3: All tests are based on international research, reviewed by experts, ensuring accuracy and credibility. MindMeter is committed to absolute confidentiality of personal information, only you know your test results. All tools are free, user-friendly, and easy to use on any device.
introduce.strength1: Take depression, anxiety, stress, postpartum depression tests... with detailed, easy-to-understand analysis results.
introduce.strength2: Receive advice and suitable guidance based on test results, helping you proactively care for your mental health.
introduce.strength3: Store test history, track your mental health progress over time.
introduce.strength4: Modern interface, multi-device support, easy to use anytime, anywhere.
introduce.strength5: Support for consultation, connect with experts when needed.
introduce.vision: is to become the leading online mental health support platform in Vietnam, contributing to building a healthy, happy community without stigma about mental health issues.
introduce.why: Because we not only provide test tools but also accompany and support you on your mental health care journey. MindMeter always updates new tests, scientific knowledge, and expands its expert network to bring the best value to the community.

studentHome.testOnlineP1: Online depression tests are reliable and essential tools for everyone. If you ignore the signs of depression and do not get timely treatment, the consequences can be very serious. People with prolonged depression may face physical health problems, insomnia, reduced work productivity, and even suicidal thoughts.
studentHome.testOnlineP2: Therefore, if you suspect you have psychological, depressive, anxiety, or stress symptoms, take the depression tests at MindMeter.vn for an accurate diagnosis. This way, you can promptly seek help from experts and apply appropriate treatment methods. This not only helps you improve your quality of life but also prevents serious consequences. Don’t hesitate, take the depression tests today for your own health and happiness!

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Depression Tests
faq.desc: Below are some common questions and issues that people with depression often encounter.

list.q: Where does the website's depression test data come from? Is it reliable?
list.a: The tests are built based on scientific research and reviewed by experts to ensure reliability and accuracy.

list.q: Are the depression tests on the website categorized by target groups?
list.a: Yes, the tests are categorized by age group, target audience, and intended use.

list.q: How many types of depression tests are there on MindMeter?
list.a: There are many types of tests such as DASS-21, BDI, EPDS, RADS, SAS... suitable for different groups.

list.q: What standards does the website use to assess depression levels?
list.a: The website uses international scales such as DASS-21, BDI, EPDS, SAS... which are widely recognized.

list.q: How many times can I take these tests? Do I need to register an account?
list.a: You can retake the tests whenever needed and do not need to register an account.

list.q: Is my data secure after taking the test?
list.a: All personal data is absolutely confidential and not shared with third parties.

list.q: What will I receive after completing the test? (results, advice, recommendations, etc.)
list.a: You will receive an assessment result, advice, and guidance suitable for your condition.

list.q: Does MindMeter show detailed results or just a summary?
list.a: You will receive both an overview and detailed analysis of each indicator.

list.q: Does the website update tests according to the latest psychological research?
list.a: The website always updates new tests to match modern research trends.

list.q: If I haven't answered all the questions in the test, can I still see the results?
list.a: You need to complete all questions to get the most accurate results.

consult.bullets: Our team of experts is carefully vetted and highly experienced.
Absolute confidentiality of personal information and counseling content.
Various forms of consultation: online, by phone, or in-person meetings.
Flexible appointment scheduling to suit your needs.
consult.contactDesc: Please contact us via email <1>{{email}}</1> or phone <3>{{phone}}</3>. You can also leave your information in the 'Contact' section for support.
